input_data.title: Will & Grace
input_data.overview: Will Truman and Grace Adler are best friends living in New York, and when Grace's engagement falls apart, she moves in with Will. Together, along with their friends, they go through the trials of dating, sex, relationships and their careers, butting heads at times but ultimately supporting one another while exchanging plenty of witty banter along the way.

response.analytical_summary: Will & Grace is a sitcom centered on the close friendship between a gay lawyer and his female best friend, navigating the complexities of love, career, and life in New York City. The series blends observational humor with a focus on character relationships and evolving social dynamics. Known for its witty dialogue and ensemble cast, the show explores themes of identity, acceptance, and the enduring power of friendship, often with a lighthearted and optimistic tone. It helped to normalize LGBTQ+ representation in mainstream television and remains a beloved example of classic sitcom storytelling.

Throughout the initial seasons, the characters grapple with romantic relationships, career setbacks, and personal growth, often leading to hilarious misunderstandings and heartwarming moments. As the series progresses, the characters face evolving social landscapes and personal challenges, including navigating changing relationship dynamics and confronting societal prejudices. While romantic pursuits are a recurring theme, the core of the show remains the enduring bond between Will and Grace, who consistently support each other through thick and thin, ultimately reaffirming the importance of chosen family and unwavering friendship. Later seasons see the characters revisiting past storylines and exploring new avenues for personal and professional fulfillment, solidifying their place as a beloved and enduring part of television history.
response.keyword_sentence: Will & Grace is a lighthearted sitcom set in New York City, exploring themes of friendship, identity, and love through the lives of an endearing ensemble cast navigating career challenges and the complexities of modern relationships.
